conclusion: Understanding the setup of the electromagnetic aircraft launch system.
Description of the mover's operation and stages of the launch process.
Explanation of the v-t graph and key points t₁, t₂, and t₃.
Identification of the task: finding the current I of the constant current source.
Introduction to the acceleration phase from t=0 to t₁.
Calculation of the magnetic force on the coil using F = n * I * l * B.
Details of the parameters: n, l, B, and the formula for magnetic force.
Calculation of the total mass being accelerated: M + m = 15 kg.
Calculation of acceleration using a = v₁ / t₁.
Calculation of the force using F = (M + m) * a.
Equating magnetic force to total force to find I: 10 I = 800 N, thus I = 80 A.
Re-evaluation of the correctness of the calculated current I.
Consideration of other forces during the acceleration phase.
Confirmation of the negligible effect of air resistance and aircraft takeoff.
Final determination that I = 80 A is the answer.
Introduction to the second part of the problem from t₁ to t₃.
Description of the retraction force F and magnetic force during deceleration.
Consideration of the consistency of I with the second part of the problem.
Reflection on the necessity of considering the second part for finding I.
